gov.usgs.locator

Class Restimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.locator.Restimator

  • public class Restimator
extends java.lang.Object
    Rank-sum estimator implementation for the NEIC Locator.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Restimator(java.util.ArrayList<Wresidual> wResiduals)
      Remember the weighted residual storage.

      Remove the median from the residuals.

      Compute the median of the linear estimates of the travel-time residuals (excluding the Bayesian depth residual).

      Compute the R-estimator penalty function or dispersion.

      Compute the median of the travel-time residuals (excluding the Bayesian depth residual, of course).

      Compute the R-estimator penalty function or dispersion.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Restimator

        public Restimator(java.util.ArrayList<Wresidual> wResiduals)
        Remember the weighted residual storage.
        Parameters:
        wResiduals - residual storage

    • Method Detail

      • median

        public double median()
        Compute the median of the travel-time residuals (excluding the Bayesian depth residual, of course).
        Returns:
        Median of travel-time residuals

      • spread

        public double spread()
        Compute the normalized median absolute deviation or spread of the travel-time residuals (excluding the Bayesian depth residual). Note that the median is remembered from the median method.
        Returns:
        The spread of the travel-time residuals

      • deMedianRes

        public void deMedianRes()
        Remove the median from the residuals. Note that the median is remembered from the median method.

      • deMedianDesign

        public void deMedianDesign()
        Remove the medians from each row of the design matrix. Note that the positions of the median values corresponds to the positions for the residual, not their design values. Obviously, the median method must be invoked before deMedianDesign to determine these positions and no other method that re-sorts the residuals (i.e., spread and penalty) may be invoked in between.

      • penalty

        public double penalty()
        Compute the R-estimator penalty function or dispersion. Note that the median is remembered from the median method.
        Returns:
        the R-estimator dispersion

      • steepest

        public double[] steepest(int n)
        Compute the steepest descents direction. This depends on the wResiduals sort order created the penalty method, so median and spread methods should not be invoked between.
        Parameters:
        n - Number of degrees of freedom (n = 2 for fixed depth, n=3 for free depth)
        Returns:
        The steepest descents direction unit vector

      • estMedian

        public double estMedian()
        Compute the median of the linear estimates of the travel-time residuals (excluding the Bayesian depth residual).
        Returns:
        Median of estimated travel-time residuals

      • deMedianEstRes

        public void deMedianEstRes()
        Remove the median from the estimated residuals.

      • estPenalty

        public double estPenalty()
        Compute the R-estimator penalty function or dispersion. Note that the median is remembered from the estMedian method.
        Returns:
        the R-estimator dispersion for the estimated residuals
